metadata.Title: CVE-2017-1000494 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Uninitialized stack variable vulnerability in NameValueParserEndElt (upnpreplyparse.c) in miniupnpd < 2.0 allows an attacker to cause Denial of Service (Segmentation fault and Memory Corruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-1000494` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libminiupnpc10 - 1.9.20140610-4ubuntu2
miniupnpc - 1.9.20140610-4ubuntu2
python-miniupnpc - 1.9.20140610-4ubuntu2
No subscription required

miniupnpd - 2.0.20171212-2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> bug mentions second issue, which is fixed by https://github.com/miniupnp/miniupnp/commit/a0573e251817ec090a8c9f9f41b56d720c835a6c doesn't seem to be a CVE number for the second issue  Another issue in https://github.com/miniupnp/miniupnp/issues/267 fixed by https://github.com/miniupnp/miniupnp/commit/9fcc0a72f09e6e1aa46ddcc997d3dcae87d4b416 (miniupnpd only) no cve number either

criterions.comment: miniupnpc package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.20140610-4ubuntu2').
miniupnpd package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.20171212-2').
